item.title: Warhammer 40000: Boltgun Expansion Announced
item.description:
Highlights

  • Warhammer 40000: Boltgun expansion 'Forges of Corruption' adds new stages and powerful new weapons like Multi-Melta and Missile Launcher.
  • The expansion includes a new Horde Mode DLC for all players to challenge endless waves of Chaos enemies, adding more action to the game.
  • Fans can expect humorous testimonials and epic battles against Chaos Space Marines in the over-the-top style trailer for the upcoming expansion.

Developer Auroch Digital is working on a new expansion for its celebrated retro shooter, Warhammer 40000: Boltgun . Based on the iconic Warhammer 40K setting, Boltgun first released on May 23, 2023, putting the expansion's announcement right on time for the base game to celebrate its first anniversary.

Recent years have seen a number of new releases based on Games Workshop's beloved far-future setting. Even major franchises like Call of Duty featured a Warhammer 40K crossover that added Space Marine and Astra Militarum-themed cosmetics to the normally realistic aesthetic of Modern Warfare 3 . Meanwhile, Warhammer 40000: Boltgun blended the exaggerated violence of 40K with the fast-paced mobility of a retro shooter , taking inspirations from genre classics like Doom and Quake.

Related
Warhammer 40K Boltgun Continues the Heyday for Boomer Shooters

The burgeoning Boomer Shooter FPS subgenre gets another incredible entry in the form of Warhammer 40K Boltgun, a retro-style shooter packing heat.

As the game turns a year old, publisher Focus Entertainment revealed at the recent Warhammer Skulls event that its expansion for Warhammer 40000: Boltgun is called Forges of Corruption . It'll add new stages and more tools to the already-considerable arsenal of the best Warhammer 40000: Boltgun weapons . The expansion will launch on June 18, 2024 for PC, Xbox Series X|S, PS4, PS5, and Xbox One. The Switch version of the expansion will launch later, at an unspecified date.

Warhammer 40000: Boltgun Expansion Includes Free Horde Mode DLC for All

Focus Entertainment gave fans a look at what's coming in the Warhammer 40000: Boltgun Forges of Corruption expansion via a trailer. Done in the over-the-top style of classic "boomer shooter" commercials and featuring humorous testimonials from fans, the Boltgun expansion trailer confirms that players will once again control a member of the Ultramarines Space Marine Chapter. They'll dive into the depths of a Manufactorum facility and purge the forces of the Chaos heretics that have taken it over. The expansion will add new stages based on the Manufactorum and its environs teeming with daemons.

The Forges of Corruption add-on will add several new enemies for players to fight based on the Chaos Space Marines Black Legion. These include the Black Legion Havoc, a Chaos Marine wielding heavy weaponry, and the Helbrute, a Space Marine dreadnought mecha corrupted by Chaos. The expansion also adds new weapons, like the Multi-Melta, a gun that shoots powerful gouts of flame, and the Missile Launcher, which fires powerful unguided missiles. Finally, the launch of the add-on will also coincide with a new addition that all Boltgun players can enjoy for free: A new Horde Mode. Like all the best video game horde modes , Boltgun 's new DLC will challenge players to take on endless waves of increasingly powerful foes.

item.title: MultiVersus Leak Reveals Season 1 Battle Pass Skins
item.description:
Highlights

  • New MultiVersus leak reveals exciting Season 1 Battle Pass skins like Amazon Lebron James and Matrix Code Jason.
  • Several new characters, including Jason Voorhees, Agent Smith, and Joker, join the game's roster, surprising players.
  • MultiVersus Season 1 Battle Pass will cost 950 Gleamium, with over 1150 Gleamium up for grabs, offering a ten-tier shortcut for 2350 Gleamium.

A new MultiVersus leak has revealed all Season 1 Battle Pass skins. With less than a week to go until MultiVersus ' release, the announcements and leaks just keep on coming. These reveal exciting aspects of the 2D side-scrolling platform fighter, which returns after a hiatus.

Among the most exciting MultiVersus news is the announcement of new characters, with Jason Voorhees, Agent Smith from The Matrix , and Mark Hamill's Joker joining the game's roster. Surprising players, MultiVersus has made Banana Guard a playable character , expanding the list of Bruisers available in the game. Other new features in MultiVersus include PvE mode, which will bring an extra experience beyond platform combat. For MultiVersus players curious to know what cosmetics will be released in Season 1, a new leak has brought exciting news.

Related
MultiVersus Showcases Anticipated New Stage

MultiVersus shares a new look at one of the game's anticipated upcoming stages and reveals the challenges that await players.

A leak shared by Twitter user Shaggy_Leaks revealed all the skins included in the MultiVersus Season 1 Battle Pass. The series of Tweets revealed the Amazon Lebron James, Biker Stripe Teir, Matrix Code Jason, and Tycoon Reindog skins, which will be unlocked when players reach tiers 13, 21, 38, and 42, respectively. The Explorer Velma, Muddy Jake, Tazmanian She-Devil, and Wedding Steven skins will be the rewards for tiers 50, 54, 62, and 67. To celebrate the addition of Jason Voorhees in MultiVersus , the iconic character will get a second skin, Uber Jason, unlocked at tier 70.

MutliVersus Season 1 Battle Pass Will Add Skins For Eight Characters

  • Amazon Lebron James - Tier 13
  • Biker Stripe - Tier 21
  • Matrix Code Jason - Tier 38
  • Tycoon Reindog - Tier 42
  • Explorer Velma - Tier 50
  • Muddy Jake - Tier 54
  • Tasmanian She-Devil - Tier 62
  • Wedding Steven - Tier 67
  • Uber Jason - Tier 70

Another MultiVersus leak shared by Twitter user multiversusie provided important information about Gleamium, the game's currency. According to them, the MultiVersus Season 1 Battle Pass will cost around 950 Gleamium and will have over 1150 Gleamium up for grabs. Meanwhile, MultiVersus players will be able to buy a 10 tier shortcut to finish the pass faster for the price of 2350 Gleamium. With the launch of Season 1, MultiVersus monetization will change , introducing Gleamium and three different types of currency. Gleamium, specifically, will be the MultiVersus currency used to buy cosmetics, emotes, battle passes, and more.

Launching on May 28, MultiVersus has a big challenge ahead , and it's no different with the Season 1 Battle Pass. To make the battle pass fun and rewarding for its players, MultiVersus devs have increased the number of high-value items in the free and paid tiers, adding more ringouts, character variants, taunts, and currency. Gleamium can be earned in both tiers, while those who played the MultiVersus beta will receive a free premium Battle Pass as a thank-you for their support.

item.title: Pokemon Fans Create Baby Form for Tropius
item.description:
Highlights

  • Talented fans create adorable baby form for Tropius, adding new details while staying true to its adult design.
  • Tropius, a unique Grass/Flying Pokemon from Gen 3, lacks evolutions, sparking fan creations like Platiny and Tropette.
  • Fan artists MengShuZ and Soyalexalan collaborate to imagine Tropius' new forms, showcasing creativity and dedication to the Pokemon franchise.

A couple of artistically talented and collaborative Pokemon fans have come together to create a new baby form for the popular Pokemon Tropius. The adorable fan-made design retains much of the look of its fully-grown adult form, while incorporating clever new details which easily cue Pokemon fans in on what exactly the creature is supposed to be.

Introduced as part of Pokemon 's third generation, Tropius is a dual-type Grass/Flying Pokemon resembling a sauropod, which includes dinosaurs such as the Brachiosaurus. It is one of only a relative handful of Pokemon not known to evolve into or from any other Pokemon. With nothing being significantly done with the Pokemon in the six generations that have transpired since its introduction, many Pokemon fans think Tropius needs a new evolution or buff, the former of which these Pokemon fans have attempted to create.

Related
Pokemon Fan Art Shows What Mawile Would Look Like as a Human

An artistically talented and prolific Pokemon fan artist imagines what Mawile would look like as a human, with some impressive results.

The Pokemon fan artist involved with the baby form of Tropius go by the handles of MengShuZ and Soyalexalan, where MengShuZ posted the finished product to a popular Pokemon forum page on Reddit. The adorable baby Tropius, called Platiny, is instantly recognizable for what it is, bearing the same colorings as its adult self. Platiny features rounded green spikes on its back, likely representing budding leaves. In addition to having a stubbier silhouette of its full-sized dinosaur-based Pokemon counterpart, Platiny is wearing a banana peel on its head like a helmet, likely sourced from the neck of its Tropius mother.

The first slide is a standard shot of the fan-made Pokemon, while the second slide showcases the baby Tropius in a spectrum of different emotions. According to the post's comments, the original design of the Pokemon belongs to Soyalexalan, while MengShuZ turned it into a fully rigged 3D model. The design is surprisingly diversified from another Pokemon fan's baby Tropius concept , called Tropette, which appears to stick a bit more closely to Tropius' original design.

Trying to Transform Tropius

Tropius' total lack of evolutions has also inspired fans to imagine more than a baby form, with one Pokemon fan creating a Tropius Mega Evolution . The design features an almost overgrown version of Tropius with massive frayed leaves that have turned into an autumn-like color. The appendages on its head and neck are greatly bolstered and sharpened, giving the docile Pokemon an intimidating look. While it remains to be seen if Tropius will ever receive a new evolution or buff of any kind, developers can always look to the prolific Pokemon fan art for inspiration.

item.title: Persona 6 Placeholder Logo Leaks
item.description:
Highlights

  • Atlus insider shares potential Persona 6 logo, sparking fan speculation on symbolism and themes for the highly anticipated game.
  • Fans predict Persona 6 announcement at The Game Awards, with potential themes of greed and envy based on leaked green color scheme.
  • Placeholder logo similarities to Persona 5 hint at potential design direction for Persona 6, leaving fans excited for official reveal.

A development logo for Persona 6 has been shared by a known Atlus insider. Fans have been looking forward to Persona 6 since before the dust settled on Persona 5 , which initially released in 2016, and got a re-release in 2019. Those familiar with Atlus, which is notoriously tight-lipped when it comes to upcoming games, have taken to trying to find hidden meanings in every announcement by the company.

Fans have been wondering when they may hear more information about Persona 6 , including when the title will be officially revealed by Atlus. Earlier this May, Midori shared their thoughts on when to expect a Persona 6 announcement , using some of the most anticipated gaming events of the year as potential benchmarks. A likely time for Persona 6 's announcement appears to be The Game Awards in December, which is when many people also expect to hear more about Switch 2, a rumored platform for the game.

Related
Metaphor: ReFantazio Skips One Feature That Persona 6 Can Swing for the Fences On

Metaphor: ReFantazio is skipping out on a mainstay of the Persona series, leaving room for Persona 6 to make drastic improvements.

Atlus insider and Persona leaker Midori shared what they claim to be Persona 6 's placeholder logo . The image shows a lowercase "p" interlinked with the number six, as if the numbers are part of a chain, or potentially alluding to an infinity symbol. Some fans who are trying to figure out the logo's symbolism have been helped out by Midori, who hints that the interlocked "p6" are "on the edge of yin and yang."

Persona 6 Development Logo Could Reveal More

This is not the first time Midori has shared details about Persona 6 , including the game's green theme. Although much of the material shared is subject to change, and Midori states that this is not the final logo, pictures of the placeholder logo from Persona 5 's announcement show similarities to the version of the title released in 2016.

Persona fans who did not expect to see news about the upcoming release so soon are shocked, and one of the most exciting things to these gamers is the green background and black text of the photo. The Persona games typically use colors to indicate tone and theme for each release. Using examples from the modern Persona series, Persona 5 used red to emphasize its rebellious tone and themes centered around anger and corruption. Persona 4 used yellow, which emphasized its optimistic outlook despite hardships, and Persona 3 used blue to highlight the melancholy surrounding its atmosphere.

Although the green theme of the game was previously leaked, fans are excited to see a visual to go along with their expectations. Previously, gamers used a popular "paint bucket theory," looking at the bucket of green paint from Persona 's 25th anniversary art, which stood suspiciously at the end of a line of series protagonists. Deeper dives into the color theory of the Persona franchise suggest that greed and envy may be key themes, but the dedicated fanbase will keep guessing until Atlus shows something official.

item.title: Call of Duty Kicks Off Double XP Event for MW3 and Warzone
item.description:
Highlights

  • Earn double XP in MW3 & Warzone until June 3, boosting levels easily.
  • Season 4 update brings new content like maps, equipment, game modes.
  • Unclear ties to Black Ops 6, mysterious campaign raises player intrigue.

Call of Duty operators can earn double XP for an extended but limited time in Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone . Those looking to boost their level in Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone will be able to receive double XP through the end of Season 3.

The development comes on the heels of the official reveal for Season 4 as well as the reveal for the newest Call of Duty title, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . No additional details have been revealed, but a Black Ops 6 Direct is scheduled for June 9 after the Xbox Games Showcase.

Related
What to Expect From the Call of Duty Franchise in 2024

Call of Duty is bigger than ever before, and though it feels like MW3 has just come out, 2024 is almost here and so is the next phase of CoD.

As of this writing the Call of Duty Double XP period is currently live and will last until June 3 at 10 am PST. This means that players will be able to boost their online level until Season 3 ends on May 29, and jump-start their climb to prestige through the beginning of Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone Season 4 . Those who don't yet own Modern Warfare 3 will also be able to play the Multiplayer and Zombies modes for free from May 30 to June 3.

According to the official Call of Duty blog, Season 4 is going to bring with it some major content updates to Modern Warfare 3 's multiplayer modes, including Zombies. Modern Warfare players can expect new maps, new equipment, and new game modes designed to force players to change up their tactics to win. Most of Warzone 's updates concern the Urzikstan map, where players will find activity around certain bunkers, along with different ways to exfiltrate to victory. Players will also find new content in Warzone designed to revitalize the Battle Royale mode. Players will also find new game modes, new vehicles, and even new Gulag layouts. Also coming to Call of Duty are the Mobile Suit Gundam bundle packs and skins , allowing players to hit the battlefield dressed as various mechs from the Gundam series.

Black Ops 6 Tie-Ins Possible, Unclear

With very few details regarding Black Ops 6 , it's unclear whether some of the updates are lead-ins to the plot of the game, or fit into the story in any way at all. The blog post warns players that as the season goes on, certain modes will see increased levels of "[[REDACTED]]" as they get "one step closer to the truth." The current tagline for Black Ops 6 is "The Truth Lies," which seems to line up with the word choice in the blog post as well as the liberal use of "[[REDACTED]]" throughout. The enigmatic marketing campaign for the game is underway, but no concrete direct connections have yet been found between it and Warzone or Modern Warfare 3 .
